Any information relating to an identifiable person
Historical information published about a monument

questions.question: Organizations should protect personal information by which of the following methods?

answers.text: Physical measures, for example, shredding documents and locking desk drawers
Organizational measures, for example, security clearances and limiting access on a 'need-to-know' basis
Technological measures, for example, the use of passwords and encryption

lifelines.phoneAFriend: Answer D sounds the most logical to me.

10,000,000 euros or up to 1% of annual turnover, whichever is greater
20,000,000 euros or up to 4% of annual turnover, whichever is greater

questions.question: GDPR applies to which types of individuals or organizations?

answers.text: Any organization that processes personal data
All data controllers and processors established in the EU and organizations that target EU resident
Data controllers operating in the EU

questions.question: What is considered as legal consent in the GDPR?

answers.text: Clicking OK to the GDPR pop up without actually reading it
A clear action where the data subject freely and specifically expresses their consent to the processing of personal data
A pre-ticked box which automatically provides user consent

lifelines.phoneAFriend: I think the answer is B

questions.question: In the context of digital analytics, what condition does the provider need to meet for data collection to be lawful within the GDPR?

answers.text: They need to obtain their users' consent
They must inform their users of the processing they do on their personal data
They must inform the supervisory authority in advance of any processing operations
